title: Blocking Property of Certain Persons With Respect to Serious Human Rights Abuses by the Government of Iran and Taking Certain Other Actions

enrichment.summary: This executive order blocks the property and interests of individuals and entities involved with serious human rights abuses by the Government of Iran. It also prohibits U.S. persons from providing funds, goods, or services to these blocked persons and authorizes relevant officials to enforce these sanctions and visa restrictions to address the national emergency related to Iran's actions.
potential_concerns: The blocking of property and visa restrictions on Iranian government officials and associated persons may exacerbate diplomatic tensions, affecting foreign governments and citizens-of-specific-countries-by-eo-designation.
Sanctions may unintentionally restrict lawful permanent residents and visa holders from Iran in the U.S., complicating their ability to access funds or resources tied to blocked persons.

The broad prohibition on dealings with blocked persons could unintentionally impact foreign nationals connected to those individuals, potentially disrupting international business or humanitarian activities.

Visa restrictions targeting individuals involved in human rights abuses may lead to challenges in verifying involvement, raising concerns about due process and potential wrongful inclusion of visa holders or foreign nationals.
